intro: Calophanes ciliatus, commonly known as the hairy calophane, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a hairy texture, giving it its common name. Calophanes ciliatus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
